In actual prices in £s and including VAT. Provided by BEIS/DEFRA in the official report on GHG Emissions of the UK between 1996-2018. Where source emission factors are identical across a variety of activities they have been grouped to avoid confusion - details are documented in the OEFDB data guidance.

name: Vehicle repair and servicing
description: Emission intensity of supply chain in GBP spend on: car/van/motorcycle repairs servicing and other work. In actual prices in £s and including VAT. Provided by BEIS/DEFRA in the official report on GHG Emissions of the UK between 1996-2018. Where source emission factors are identical across a variety of activities they have been grouped to avoid confusion - details are documented in the OEFDB data guidance.

name: Education (fees/trips)
description: Emission intensity of supply chain in GBP spend on: education/ educational trips. In actual prices in £s and including VAT. Provided by BEIS/DEFRA in the official report on GHG Emissions of the UK between 1996-2018. Where source emission factors are identical across a variety of activities they have been grouped to avoid confusion - details are documented in the OEFDB data guidance.

name: Coal fired plant
description: Emission intensity for coal fired plant. The data scope includes upstream and combustion emissions. Updated December 2018. Published by ADEME.

name: Electricity
description: Emission intensity of supply chain in GBP spend on: electricity. In actual prices in £s and including VAT. Provided by BEIS/DEFRA in the official report on GHG Emissions of the UK between 1996-2018. Where source emission factors are identical across a variety of activities they have been grouped to avoid confusion - details are documented in the OEFDB data guidance.

name: Gas fired plant
description: Emission intensity for gas fired plant. The data scope includes upstream and combustion emissions. Updated December 2018. Published by ADEME.

name: Nuclear plant
description: Emission intensity for nuclear power plant. The data scope includes upstream emissions. Published by ADEME.

name: Geothermal energy
description: Emission intensity for geothermal energy. The data scope includes only upstream emissions for energy resource and the emissions related to the manufacture and maintenance of the production chain. The use of the primary energy source in itself is considered to be emission-free. Updated 2016. Published by ADEME.

name: Grid mix
description: Emission intensity of grid mix as reported. The values take electrical and thermal kWh supply into account. Cross-border power exchanges are not included. The publication covers only direct emissions from power plants. Provided by the IEA in 2011. Published by ADEME.

name: Grid mix
description: Emission intensity of grid mix as reported. The values take electrical and thermal kWh supply into account. Cross-border power exchanges are not included. The publication covers only direct emissions from power plants. Provided by the IEA in 2011. Published by ADEME.

name: Grid mix
description: Emission intensity of electricity generated as reported. Available in BEISs Greenhouse Gas Reporting: Conversion Factors 2021. name: Offshore wind turbine
description: Emission intensity for offshore wind turbine. The data scope includes only upstream emissions for energy resource and the emissions related to the manufacture and maintenance of the production chain. The use of the primary energy source in itself is considered to be emission-free. Updated 2016. Published by ADEME.

name: Oil steam plant
description: Emission intensity for oil steam plant. The data scope includes upstream and combustion emissions. Updated December 2018. Published by ADEME.

name: Onshore wind turbine
description: Emission intensity for onshore wind turbine. The data scope includes only upstream emissions for energy resource and the emissions related to the manufacture and maintenance of the production chain. The use of the primary energy source in itself is considered to be emission-free. Updated 2016. Published by ADEME.

name: Photovoltaic (Made in China)
description: Emission intensity for photovoltaic made in China. The data scope includes only upstream emissions for energy resource and the emissions related to the manufacture and maintenance of the production chain. The use of the primary energy source in itself is considered to be emission-free. If the country of production is not known the default value to be used is "Photovoltaic electricity - China production". Updated 2016. Published by ADEME.

name: Photovoltaic (Made in Europe)
description: Emission intensity for photovoltaic made in Europe. The data scope includes only upstream emissions for energy resource and the emissions related to the manufacture and maintenance of the production chain. The use of the primary energy source in itself is considered to be emission-free. If the country of production is not known the default value to be used is "Photovoltaic electricity - China production". Updated 2016. Published by ADEME.

name: Photovoltaic (Made in France)
description: Emission intensity for photovoltaic made in France. The data scope includes only upstream emissions for energy resource and the emissions related to the manufacture and maintenance of the production chain. The use of the primary energy source in itself is considered to be emission-free. If the country of production is not known the default value to be used is "Photovoltaic electricity - China production". Updated 2016. Published by ADEME.

name: Aviation fuel (avgas)
description: Emission intensity of aviation gasoline. Published by the Ministry for the Environment of New Zealand in 2020.

name: Aviation fuel (avgas)
description: Emission intensity of aviation spirit fuel for piston-engined aircraft - a high octane petrol (aka AVGAS). The fuels conversion factors should be used for primary fuel sources combusted at a site or in an asset owned or controlled by the reporting organisation. Available in BEIS Greenhouse Gas Reporting: Conversion Factors 2021.

name: Aviation fuel (avgas)
description: Emission intensity for aviation fuel (avgas). The fuels conversion factors should be used for primary fuel sources combusted at a site or in an asset owned or controlled by the reporting organisation. Available in BEIS Greenhouse Gas Reporting: Conversion Factors 2021.

name: Aviation turbine fuel (avtur)
description: Emission intensity of aviation fuel (kerosene)/Jet A1. Published by the Ministry for the Environment of New Zealand in 2020.

name: Aviation turbine fuel (avtur)
description: Emission intensity of aviation turbine fuel for turbo-prop aircraft and jets (aka jet fuel). Similar to kerosene used as a heating fuel but refined to a higher quality. The fuels conversion factors should be used for primary fuel sources combusted at a site or in an asset owned or controlled by the reporting organisation. Available in BEIS Greenhouse Gas Reporting: Conversion Factors 2021.

name: Aviation turbine fuel (avtur)
description: Emission intensity for aviation turbine fuel. The fuels conversion factors should be used for primary fuel sources combusted at a site or in an asset owned or controlled by the reporting organisation. Available in BEIS Greenhouse Gas Reporting: Conversion Factors 2021.

name: Telephone equipment
description: Emission intensity of supply chain in GBP spend on: telephone purchase/ mobile phone purchase/ answering machine or fax machine purchase. In actual prices in £s and including VAT. Provided by BEIS/DEFRA in the official report on GHG Emissions of the UK between 1996-2018. Where source emission factors are identical across a variety of activities they have been grouped to avoid confusion - details are documented in the OEFDB data guidance.

name: Postal services
description: Emission intensity of supply chain in GBP spend on: postal services. In actual prices in £s and including VAT. Provided by BEIS/DEFRA in the official report on GHG Emissions of the UK between 1996-2018. Where source emission factors are identical across a variety of activities they have been grouped to avoid confusion - details are documented in the OEFDB data guidance.

name: Telephone/internet accounts and services
description: Emission intensity of supply chain in GBP spend on: telephone account/ telephone coin and other payments/ mobile phone account/ mobile phone other payments/ internet subscription fees. In actual prices in £s and including VAT. Provided by BEIS/DEFRA in the official report on GHG Emissions of the UK between 1996-2018. Where source emission factors are identical across a variety of activities they have been grouped to avoid confusion - details are documented in the OEFDB data guidance.

name: Bank fees

Where source emission factors are identical across a variety of activities they have been grouped to avoid confusion - details are documented in the OEFDB data guidance.

name: Property purchase and removals

In actual prices in £s and including VAT. Provided by BEIS/DEFRA in the official report on GHG Emissions of the UK between 1996-2018. Where source emission factors are identical across a variety of activities they have been grouped to avoid confusion - details are documented in the OEFDB data guidance.

name: Insurance

name: Food and beverages services (dine in and takeaway)
description: Emission intensity of supply chain in GBP spend on: restaurant and cafe meals/ alcoholic beverages/ takeaway meals/ hot food and cold food/ confectionery/ ice cream/ soft drink/ contract catering/ school meals/ meals bought in workplace. In actual prices in £s and including VAT. Provided by BEIS/DEFRA in the official report on GHG Emissions of the UK between 1996-2018. Where source emission factors are identical across a variety of activities they have been grouped to avoid confusion - details are documented in the OEFDB data guidance.

name: Domestic air freight
description: Emission intensity of freighting goods by aircraft. Contribution of fuel combustion/upstream emissions/contrails unspecified by source. Published by the EPA.

name: Domestic air freight
description: Emission intensity of domestic freight flight (within UK) including emissions from combustion and contrails but not upstream fuel emissions. Available in BEIS Greenhouse Gas Reporting: Conversion Factors 2021.

name: Domestic air freight
description: Emission intensity of domestic freight flight in New Zealand including emissions from combustion and contrails but not upstream fuel emissions. Published by the Ministry for the Environment of New Zealand in 2020.

name: Domestic air freight
description: Emission intensity of inland air cargo in Germany. Fuel combustion and upstream emissions included; detail on contrails not provided. Data from the Öko-Institut.

name: Domestic air freight <500km distance >100t weight
description: Emission intensity of air freight including fuel combustion and upstream emissions and contrails to/from or within continental France. More than 100 tonnes weight <500 kms distance. Published by ADEME. Provided by the GT Transport Base Carbone & Ecocalculateur DGAC.

name: Domestic air freight <500km distance >10t and <25t weight
description: Emission intensity of air freight including fuel combustion and upstream emissions and contrails to/from or within continental France. 10 to 25 tonnes weight <500 kms distance. Published by ADEME. Provided by the GT Transport Base Carbone & Ecocalculateur DGAC.

name: Domestic air freight <500km distance >26t and <100t weight
description: Emission intensity of air cargo including fuel combustion and upstream emissions and contrails to/from or within continental France. 26 to 100 tonnes weight <500 kms distance. Published by ADEME. Provided by the GT Transport Base Carbone & Ecocalculateur DGAC.

name: Domestic air freight >1000km and <3500km distance >100t weight
description: Emission intensity of air freight including fuel combustion and upstream emissions and contrails to/from or within continental France. More than 100 tonnes weight 1000 - 3500 kms distance. Published by ADEME. Provided by the GT Transport Base Carbone & Ecocalculateur DGAC.

name: Domestic air freight >3500km distance >100t weight
description: Emission intensity of air freight including fuel combustion and upstream emissions and contrails to/from or within continental France. More than 100 tonnes weight >3500 kms distance. 2020 Factor. Published by ADEME. Provided by the GT Transport Base Carbone & Ecocalculateur DGAC.

name: Domestic air freight >500km and <1000km distance >100t weight
description: Emission intensity of air freight including fuel combustion and upstream emissions and contrails to/from or within continental France. More than 100 tonnes weight 500 - 1000 kms distance. Published by ADEME. Provided by the GT Transport Base Carbone & Ecocalculateur DGAC.

name: Domestic air freight >500km and <1000km distance >10t and <25t weight
description: Emission intensity of air cargo including fuel combustion and upstream emissions and contrails to/from or within continental France. 10 to 25 tonnes weight 500 - 1000 kms distance. Published by ADEME. Provided by the GT Transport Base Carbone & Ecocalculateur DGAC.

name: Domestic air freight >500km and <1000km distance >26t and <100t weight
description: Emission intensity of air cargo including fuel combustion and upstream emissions and contrails to/from or within continental France. 26 to 100 tonnes weight 500 - 1000 kms distance. Published by ADEME. Provided by the GT Transport Base Carbone & Ecocalculateur DGAC.

name: International air freight
description: Emission intensity of international air cargo. Fuel combustion and upstream emissions included; detail on contrails not provided. Data from the Öko-Institut.

name: International air freight long haul
description: Emission intensity of international long-haul freight flight to or from New Zealand including emissions from combustion and contrails but not upstream fuel emissions. . Published by the Ministry for the Environment of New Zealand in 2020.

name: International air freight long haul
description: Emission intensity of long haul freight flight (to/from UK) including emissions from combustion and contrails but not upstream fuel emissions. Available in BEIS Greenhouse Gas Reporting: Conversion Factors 2021.

name: International air freight outside UK
description: Emission intensity of international freight flight (to/from non-UK countries) including emissions from combustion and contrails but not upstream fuel emissions. Available in BEIS Greenhouse Gas Reporting: Conversion Factors 2021.

name: International air freight short haul
description: Emission intensity of international short-haul freight flight to or from New Zealand including emissions from combustion and contrails but not upstream fuel emissions. Published by the Ministry for the Environment of New Zealand in 2020.

name: International air freight short haul
description: Emission intensity of short haul freight flight (to/from UK) including emissions from combustion and contrails but not upstream fuel emissions. Available in BEIS Greenhouse Gas Reporting: Conversion Factors 2021.

name: Air fares
description: Emission intensity of supply chain in GBP spend on: air fares within UK/ international flight fares. In actual prices in £s and including VAT. Provided by BEIS/DEFRA in the official report on GHG Emissions of the UK between 1996-2018. Where source emission factors are identical across a variety of activities they have been grouped to avoid confusion - details are documented in the OEFDB data guidance.

name: Domestic flight

name: Domestic flight
description: Emission intensity of domestic flight expressed as a national average with contrails. Direct fuel combustion only. Published by the Ministry for the Environment of New Zealand.

name: Domestic flight
description: Emission intensity of domestic flight in Germany. Fuel combustion and upstream emissions included; detail on contrails not provided. Data from the Öko-Institut.

name: Long-haul-flight
description: Emission Intensity of long-haul flight. Long Haul (>= 2300 miles). Published by the EPA. Updated April 2021. Contribution of fuel combustion/upstream emissions/contrails unspecified by source.

name: Medium-haul flight
description: Emission intensity of medium-haul international flights to/from/within France including contrails. Includes fuel combustion and upstream emissions. Published by ADEME. Provided by Ecocalculateur DGAC.

name: Medium-haul flight
description: Emission intensity of medium haul flight (between 300 and 2300 miles). Published by the EPA. Updated April 2021. Contribution of fuel combustion/upstream emissions/contrails unspecified by source

name: Short-haul flight
description: Emission intensity of short-haul (< 300 miles) passenger flight. Contribution of fuel combustion/upstream emissions/contrails unspecified by source. Published by the EPA.

name: Short-haul flight
description: Emission intensity of short-haul flights to/from/within France including contrails. Includes fuel combustion and upstream emissions. Published by ADEME. Provided by Ecocalculateur DGAC.

name: Rail freight diesel train
description: Emission intensity of goods transported by diesel rail freight transport. Fuel combustion and upstream LCA activity is included. Data from the Öko-Institut. Value applicable to 2020.Provided by the UBA. Accessed on the 15th of September 2021.

name: Rail freight electric train
description: Emission intensity of goods transported by electric rail freight transport. Direct electricity consumption and upstream LCA activity is included. Data from the Öko-Institut. Value applicable to 2020.Provided by the UBA. Accessed on the 15th of September 2021.

name: Rail freight train
description: Emission intensity of goods transported by rail freight transport. Based on a mixture of emissions from diesel and electricity generation. Only emissions from direct fuel combustion or generation of electricity consumed are included.  Available in BEIS Greenhouse Gas Reporting: Conversion Factors 2021.

name: Rail freight train KiwiRail
description: Emission intensity of goods transported by rail freight transport (KiwiRail). Only fuel combustion activity is included. Published by the Ministry for the Environment of New Zealand in 2020.

name: Commuter rail passenger train
description: Emission intensity for commuter rail passenger train with no information on inclusion of upstream emissions. This emission factor accounts for commuter rail services between a central city and adjacent suburbs (also called regional rail or suburban rail). It is intended for use in the distance-based method defined in the GHG Protocol Scope 3 Calculation Guidance. If fuel data are available then the fuel-based method should be used. Updated by the EPA in April 2021.

name: Diesel near passenger train
description: Emission intensity of diesel local passenger train including upstream. Data from the Öko-Institut.

name: Diesel remote passenger train
description: Emission intensity of long-distance diesel passenger train including upstream. Data from the Öko-Institut.

name: Diesel urban passenger train
description: Emission intensity for diesel urban passenger train including fuel consumption. Public transport passenger travel emission factors. Published by the Ministry for the Environment of New Zealand in 2020.

name: Electric passenger train
description: Emission intensity of an electric train journey in Ireland. Including emissions from electricity generation and transmission/distribution. Published by ADEME in May 2020.

name: Electric passenger train
description: Emission intensity of an electric train journey in Spain. Including emissions from electricity generation and transmission/distribution. Published by ADEME in May 2020.

name: Electric passenger train
description: Emission intensity of an electric train journey in the Netherlands. Including emissions from electricity generation and transmission/distribution. Published by ADEME in May 2020.

name: Electric passenger train

name: Electric passenger train
description: Emission intensity of an electric train journey in Sweden. Including emissions from electricity generation and transmission/distribution.Published by ADEME in May 2020.

name: Electric passenger train
description: Emission intensity of an electric train journey in Belgium. Including emissions from electricity generation and transmission/distribution. Published by ADEME in May 2020.

name: Electric passenger train
description: Emission intensity of an electric train journey in Italy. Including emissions from electricity generation and transmission/distribution. Published by ADEME in May 2020.

name: Electric passenger train
description: Emission intensity of an electric train journey in Corsica. Including emissions from electricity generation and transmission/distribution. Published by ADEME in May 2020.

name: Electric passenger train
description: Emission intensity of local electric passenger train powered by electricity including upstream. Data from the Öko-Institut.

name: Electric remote passenger train
description: Emission intensity of long-distance electric passenger train including upstream. Data from the Öko-Institut.

name: Intercity rail passenger NE corridor
description: Emission intensity for intercity rail passenger train (northeast corridor) with no information on inclusion of upstream emissions. This emission factor accounts for intercity rail services (long-distance rail between major cities such as Amtrak). The Northeast corridor extends from Boston to Washington D.C. Published by the EPA. Updated in April 2021.

name: Intercity rail passenger routes other than NE corridor
description: Emission intensity for intercity rail passenger train (other routes) with no information on inclusion of upstream emissions. This emission factor accounts for intercity rail services (long-distance rail between major cities such as Amtrak). Other Routes are all routes outside the Northeast Corridor. Published by the EPA. Updated in April 2021.

name: International rail passenger train
description: Emission intensity for international rail passenger train including fuel consumption. The international rail factor is based on a passenger-km weighted average of the conversion factors for the following Eurostar routes: London-Brussels/London-Paris/London-Marne Le Vallee (Disney)/London-Avignon/London-Amsterdam/London to Bourg-Saint-Maurice (ski train). The conversion factors were provided by Eurostar for the 2021 update together with information based on the electricity figures used in their calculation. Published by BEIS in June 2021.

name: Light rail and tram passenger train
description: Emission intensity for light rail and tram passenger train including fuel consumption. The light rail factors were based on an average of factors for a range of UK tram and light rail systems. Published by BEIS in June 2021.

name: National average for intercity rail passenger
description: Emission intensity for for intercity rail passenger train with no information on inclusion of upstream emissions (national average). This emission factor accounts for intercity rail services (long-distance rail between major cities such as Amtrak). Published by the EPA in April 2021.

name: National average for urban passenger train
description: Emission intensity for urban passenger train (national average) including fuel consumption. Public transport passenger travel emission factors. Published by the Ministry for the Environment of New Zealand in 2020.

name: National rail passenger train
description: Emission intensity for UK national rail passenger train including fuel consumption. The national rail factor refers to an average emission per passenger kilometre for diesel and electric trains in 2019-20. The factor is sourced from information from the Office of the Rail Regulator’s National rail trends for 2019-20 (ORR 2020). This has been calculated based on total electricity and diesel consumed by the railway for the year sourced from the Association of Train Operating Companies (ATOC) and the total number of passenger kilometres (from National Rail Trends). Published by BEIS in June 2021.

name: Underground passenger train
description: Emission intensity for London underground passenger train including fuel consumption. Published by BEIS in June 2021.

name: Urban passenger train
description: Emission intensity for average passenger train. This emission factor accounts for transit rail: rail typically within an urban center such as subways/elevated railways/Urban railways (metro)/streetcars/trolley cars/tramways. Published by the EPA. The method of calculation used is the distance-based method which involves determining the mass/distance/mode of each shipment then applying the appropriate mass-distance emission factor for the vehicle used. LCA activity is unknown. This emission factor was updated in April 2021.

name: Long-haul road freight heavy truck average value
description: Emission intensity of goods transported by long-haul heavy truck. Average value. Only fuel combustion LCA activity is included.  Published by the Ministry for the Environment of New Zealand in 2020.

name: Road freight battery EV class 1 (>1.305t)
description: Emission intensity of goods transported by electric van class 1(>1.305t). Emissions from fuel combustion only. Available in BEIS Greenhouse Gas Reporting: Conversion Factors 2021.

name: Road freight battery EV rigid HGV (3.5t -7.5t)
description: Emission intensity of goods transported by electric rigid HGV (3.5t - 7.5t). Vehicle manufacture/fuel upstream/fuel combustion LCA activities included. Published by ADEME. Provided by the GT Transport Base Carbone & the GLEC Framework.

name: Road freight battery EV vans average value (>3.5t)
description: Emission intensity of goods transported by average electric van (>3.5t). Emissions from fuel combustion only. Available in BEIS Greenhouse Gas Reporting: Conversion Factors 2021.

name: Road freight battery EV vans class 2  (1.305t - 1.74t)
description: Emission intensity of goods transported by electric van class 2 (1.305t - 1.74t). Emissions from fuel combustion only. Available in BEIS Greenhouse Gas Reporting: Conversion Factors 2021.

name: Road freight battery EV vans class 3 (1.74t - 3.5t)
description: Emission intensity of goods transported by electric van class 3 (1.74t - 3.5t). Emissions from fuel combustion only. Available in BEIS Greenhouse Gas Reporting: Conversion Factors 2021.

name: Road freight CNG HGV (3.5t-7.5t)
description: Emission intensity of goods transported by CNG HGV (3.5t - 7.5t). Emissions from fuel combustion only. Data from the Öko-Institut. Provided by the UBA. Accessed on the 15th of September 2021.

name: Road freight CNG HGV (7.5t-12t)

name: Road freight CNG hybrid parallel rigid HGV (3.5t -7.5t)

name: Road freight CNG light delivery vehicle
description: Emission intensity of goods transported by CNG light delivery vehicle. Fuel upstream and fuel combustion LCA activities included. Published by ADEME. Provided by GLEC Framework.

name: Road freight CNG light duty truck average value
description: Emission intensity of goods transported by CNG light-duty truck. Upstream and fuel combustion LCA activity is included. Data from the Öko-Institut. Provided by the UBA.

name: Road freight diesel light delivery vehicle
description: Emission intensity of goods transported by diesel (7% biodiesel) light delivery vehicle. Fuel upstream and fuel combustion LCA activities included. Published by ADEME. Provided by GLEC Framework.

name: Road freight diesel refrigerated articulated HGV (>3.5t - 33t) 100% laden

name: Road freight diesel refrigerated articulated HGV (>3.5t - 33t) 50% laden
description: Emission intensity of goods transported by diesel refrigerated articulated HGV (>3.5t - 33t) with 50% laden. Emissions from fuel combustion only. Available in BEIS Greenhouse Gas Reporting: Conversion Factors 2021.

name: Road freight diesel refrigerated articulated HGV (>3.5t - 33t) average laden
description: Emission intensity of goods transported by diesel refrigerated articulated HGV (>3.5t - 33t) with average laden. Emissions from fuel combustion only. Available in BEIS Greenhouse Gas Reporting: Conversion Factors 2021.

name: Road freight diesel refrigerated articulated HGV (>33t) average laden
description: Emission intensity of goods transported by diesel refrigerated articulated HGV (>33t) with average laden. Emissions from fuel combustion only. Available in BEIS Greenhouse Gas Reporting: Conversion Factors 2021.

name: Road freight diesel refrigerated rigid HGV (>17t) average laden
description: Emission intensity of goods transported by diesel refrigerated rigid HGV (>17t) with average laden. Emissions from fuel combustion only. Available in BEIS Greenhouse Gas Reporting: Conversion Factors 2021.

name: Road freight diesel refrigerated rigid HGV (>7.5t – 17t) average laden
description: Emission intensity of goods transported by diesel refrigerated rigid HGV (>7.5t-17t) with average laden. Emissions from fuel combustion only. Available in BEIS Greenhouse Gas Reporting: Conversion Factors 2021.

name: Road freight diesel refrigerated rigid HGV 100% laden
description: Emission intensity of goods transported by diesel refrigerated rigid HGV with 100% laden. Emissions from fuel combustion only. Available in BEIS Greenhouse Gas Reporting: Conversion Factors 2021.

name: Road freight diesel refrigerated rigid HGV 50% laden
description: Emission intensity of goods transported by diesel refrigerated rigid HGV with 50% laden. Emissions from fuel combustion only. Available in BEIS Greenhouse Gas Reporting: Conversion Factors 2021. All Diesel.

name: Road freight diesel refrigerated rigid HGV average laden
description: Emission intensity of goods transported by diesel refrigerated rigid HGV with average laden. Emissions from fuel combustion only. Available in BEIS Greenhouse Gas Reporting: Conversion Factors 2021.

name: Road freight diesel refrigerated rigid HGV(>3.5t - 7.5t) average laden
description: Emission intensity of goods transported by diesel refrigerated rigid HGV (>3.5t - 7.5t) with average laden. Emissions from fuel combustion only. Available in BEIS Greenhouse Gas Reporting: Conversion Factors 2021.

name: Road freight hybrid rigid series HGV (3.5t -7.5t)
description: Emission intensity of goods transported by hybrid rigid series HGV (3.5t - 7.5t). Fuel upstream and fuel combustion LCA activities included. Published by ADEME. Provided by the GT Transport Base Carbone & the GLEC Framework.

name: Road freight LNG rigid HGV (20t - 26t)

description: Emission intensity of goods transported by LPG light delivery vehicle. Fuel upstream and fuel combustion LCA activities included. Published by ADEME. Provided by GLEC Framework.

name: Road freight medium and heavy duty truck
description: Emission intensity of goods transported by a medium- or heavy-duty truck. Average value. No information of fuel source is provided. No information on upstream or downstream LCA activity is provided. Estimated by EPA from Table 2-13 of the EPA (2020) Inventory of U.S. Greenhouse Gas Emissions and Sinks: 1990-2018

name: Road freight petrol light delivery vehicle
description: Emission intensity  of goods transported by petrol light delivery vehicle. Fuel upstream and fuel combustion LCA activities included.Published by ADEME. Provided by GLEC Framework.

name: Road freight truck average value
description: Emission intensity of goods transported by road freight truck. Average value. Only fuel combustion LCA activity is included. Published by the Ministry for the Environment of New Zealand in 2020.

name: Urban delivery road freight heavy truck average value
description: Emission intensity of urban delivery heavy truck. Average value. Only fuel combustion LCA activity is included. Published by the Ministry for the Environment of New Zealand in 2020.

description: Emission intensity for roll-on/roll-off (RoRo) Ferry. Published by BEIS in June 2021.

name: Bus and coach fares

Where source emission factors are identical across a variety of activities they have been grouped to avoid confusion - details are documented in the OEFDB data guidance.

description: Emission intensity of commercial electric vehicle. Petrol. Plug-in-hybrid. Above 3000cc. Light commercial vehicles. No upstream or downstream LCA activity is included. Post-2015 fleet.  Published by the Ministry for the Environment of New Zealand in 2020.

name: Petrol PHEV LCV (1350-1600cc)  - fuel combustion post-2015
description: Emission intensity of commercial electric vehicle. Petrol. Plug-in-hybrid. Between 1350 and 1600cc. Light commercial vehicles. No upstream or downstream LCA activity is included. Post-2015 fleet.  Published by the Ministry for the Environment of New Zealand in 2020.

name: Petrol PHEV LCV (1350-1600cc) - electricity consumption post-2015
description: Emission intensity of commercial petrol plug-in hybrid vehicle. Electricity consumption mode. Between 1350 and 1600cc. Light commercial vehicles. No upstream or downstream LCA activity is included. Post-2015 fleet.  Published by the Ministry for the Environment of New Zealand in 2020.

name: Petrol PHEV LCV (1600-2000cc) - electricity consumption post-2015
description: Emission intensity of commercial petrol plug-in hybrid vehicle. Electricity consumption mode. Between 1600 and 2000cc. Light commercial vehicles. No upstream or downstream LCA activity is included. Post-2015 fleet.  Published by the Ministry for the Environment of New Zealand in 2020.

name: Petrol PHEV LCV (1600-2000cc) - fuel combustion post-2015
description: Emission intensity of commercial electric vehicle. Petrol. Plug-in-hybrid. Between 1600 and 2000cc. Light commercial vehicles. No upstream or downstream LCA activity is included. Post-2015 fleet.  Published by the Ministry for the Environment of New Zealand in 2020.

name: Petrol PHEV LCV (2000-3000cc) - electricity consumption post-2015
description: Emission intensity of commercial petrol plug-in hybrid vehicle. Electricity consumption mode. Between 2000 and 3000cc. Light commercial vehicles. No upstream or downstream LCA activity is included. Post-2015 fleet.  Published by the Ministry for the Environment of New Zealand in 2020.

name: Petrol PHEV LCV (2000-3000cc) - fuel combustion post-2015
description: Emission intensity of commercial electric vehicle. Petrol. Plug-in-hybrid. Between 2000 and 3000cc. Light commercial vehicles. No upstream or downstream LCA activity is included. Post-2015 fleet.  Published by the Ministry for the Environment of New Zealand in 2020.

name: PHEV car (average) - electricity consumption
description: Emission intensity of electricity generation for average PHEV car. No upstream or downstream LCA activity is included. Available in BEIS Greenhouse Gas Reporting: Conversion Factors 2021.a

name: PHEV car (average) - fuel combustion
description: Emission intensity of average PHEV. Unknown engine size. No upstream or downstream LCA activity is included. Available in BEIS Greenhouse Gas Reporting: Conversion Factors 2021.

name: PHEV car (compact)
description: Emission intensity of plug in-hybrid compact vehicle (segment C) - P2/prius. Updated April 2020. Published by ADEME. Provided by the HBEFA & Yearly Compte des Transports.

name: PHEV car (dual-purpose 4X4) - electricity consumption
description: Emission intensity of electricity generation for dual purpose 4X4 PHEV car. No upstream or downstream LCA activity is included. Available in BEIS Greenhouse Gas Reporting: Conversion Factors 2021.

name: PHEV car (executive) - electricity consumption
description: Emission intensity of electricity generation for executive PHEV car. No upstream or downstream LCA activity is included. Available in BEIS Greenhouse Gas Reporting: Conversion Factors 2021.

name: PHEV car (large)
description: Emission intensity of large PHEV. 2.0-litre engine +. Generally Market Segment D and Above. No upstream or downstream LCA activity is included. Available in BEIS Greenhouse Gas Reporting: Conversion Factors 2021.

name: PHEV car (large) - electricity consumption
description: Emission intensity of electricity generation for large PHEV car. No upstream or downstream LCA activity is included. Available in BEIS Greenhouse Gas Reporting: Conversion Factors 2021.

name: PHEV car (lower medium) - electricity consumption
description: Emission intensity of electricity generation for lower medium PHEV car. This is a small compact family car. Examples include: Volkswagen Golf Ford Focus Opel Astra Audi A3 BMW 1 Series Renault Mégane and Toyota Auris. No upstream or downstream LCA activity is included. Available in BEIS Greenhouse Gas Reporting: Conversion Factors 2021.

name: PHEV car (luxury) - electricity consumption
description: Emission intensity of electricity generation for luxury PHEV car. This is a luxury car which is niche in the European market. Examples include: Jaguar XF Mercedes-Benz S-Class BMW 7 series Audi A8 Porsche Panamera and Lexus LS. Available in BEIS Greenhouse Gas Reporting: Conversion Factors 2021.

name: PHEV car (medium)
description: Emission intensity of electricity generation for medium PHEV car. No upstream or downstream LCA activity is included. Available in BEIS Greenhouse Gas Reporting: Conversion Factors 2021.

name: PHEV car (medium) - fuel combustion
description: Emission intensity of medium PHEV. Generally market segment C. No upstream or downstream LCA activity is included. Available in BEIS Greenhouse Gas Reporting: Conversion Factors 2021.

name: PHEV car (sedan)
description: Emission intensity of plug in-hybrid sedan car - P2/prius. Published by ADEME. Provided by the HBEFA & Yearly Compte des Transports.

name: PHEV car (small) - electricity consumption
description: Emission intensity of electricity generation for small PHEV car. No upstream or downstream LCA activity is included. Available in BEIS Greenhouse Gas Reporting: Conversion Factors 2021.

name: PHEV car (small) - fuel combustion
description: Emission intensity of small PHEV car. Market segment A or B. No upstream or downstream LCA activity is included. Available in BEIS Greenhouse Gas Reporting: Conversion Factors 2021.

name: PHEV car (sports) - electricity consumption
description: Emission intensity of electricity generation for sports PHEV car. Sport cars are a small usually two seater with two doors and designed for speed high acceleration and manoeuvrability. Examples include: Mercedes-Benz SLK Audi TT Porsche 911 and Boxster and Peugeot RCZ. No upstream or downstream LCA activity is included. Available in BEIS Greenhouse Gas Reporting: Conversion Factors 2021.

name: PHEV car (supermini) - electricity consumption
description: Emission intensity of electricity generation for supermini PHEV car. This is a car that is larger than a city car but smaller than a small family car. Examples include: Ford Fiesta Renault CLIO Volkswagen Polo Citroën C2 and C3 Opel Corsa Peugeot 208 and Toyota Yaris. No upstream or downstream LCA activity is included. Available in BEIS Greenhouse Gas Reporting: Conversion Factors 2021.

name: PHEV car (upper medium) - electricity consumption
description: Emission intensity of electricity generation for upper medium PHEV car. No upstream or downstream LCA activity is included. This is classed as a large family car. Examples include: BMW 3 Series ŠKODA Octavia Volkswagen Passat Audi A4 Mercedes Benz C Class and Peugeot 508. Available in BEIS Greenhouse Gas Reporting: Conversion Factors 2021.

name: PHEV light vehicle with auxiliary power unit
description: Emission intensity of plug-in hybrid with auxiliary power unit light vehicle (segment A). Updated April 2020. Published by ADEME. Provided by the HBEFA & Yearly Compte des Transports.

name: Taxi (average)
description: Emission intensity of regular taxi. Available in BEIS Greenhouse Gas Reporting: Conversion Factors 2021.

name: Taxi (average) post-2015
description: Emission intensity of average taxi by distance travelled. Default factor. No upstream or downstream LCA activity is included. Published by the Ministry for the Environment of New Zealand in 2020.

name: Vehicle purchase
description: Emission intensity of supply chain in GBP spend on: new/secondhand cars/vans outright purchase/hire lease. In actual prices in £s and including VAT. Provided by BEIS/DEFRA in the official report on GHG Emissions of the UK between 1996-2018. Where source emission factors are identical across a variety of activities they have been grouped to avoid confusion - details are documented in the OEFDB data guidance.
